channel.title: RuneTopia | Advanced RuneScape 2006 Remake
channel.description:
[center][img]http://oi59.tinypic.com/2s16io5.jpg[/img][/center]
[center][b]The Most Advanced 2006 Remake [/b][/center]
[center]Reserve your username now by creating a free account at: http://runetopia.com
Note: Our website is currently being worked on.
RuneTopia has been in development for a few months now, and we have already put the time in to get all the skills to work, including quests & minigames. Unlike other remakes, our team is mature and professional at tackling with updates, and helping out the community. You can view our features below.
We won't be basing our 2006 remake on only just the first 6 months of RS06, but we want to take it further, and make it so you can have the true feeling of the whole year.
[b]We will be having an iron man mode too[/b] [/center]
[center][b]Working Skills (In any order): [/b] Agility (All Courses) Attack Defence Strength Magic Ranged Hitpoints Mining Hunter Construction Runecrafting Prayer Fletching Thieving Firemaking Mining Herblore Slayer Fishing Smithing Crafting Farming [/center]
[center][u][b]Quests (20 Added):[/b][/u] Cooks Assistant Demon Slayer Dwarf Cannon (With Cannon) - 90% Complete Dorics Quest Druidic Ritual Ernest The Chicken Gertrudes Cat Goblin Diplomacy Imp Catcher Knights Sword Lost City Pirates Treasure Priest in Peril Restless Ghost Romeo and Juliet Rune Mysteries Sheep Shearer Vampyre Slayer Waterfall Quest Witch's Potion[/center]
[center] [b]Client Toggles[/b]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/GxrTcET.png[/img] [img]http://i.imgur.com/ePaZhl1.png[/img]
[/center]
[u][b]MEDIA[/b][/u] [spoiler] [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/TTjeh1l.png[/img] [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/2F8XTua.png[/img] [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/IWJPDfk.png[/img] [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/IFgPt3P.png[/img] [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/YXrTrXy.png[/img] [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/Vm9fMjJ.png[/img] [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/t5w7zyY.png[/img] [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/2grZxW1.png[/img] [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/mfRQaH5.png[/img] [IMG]https://i.gyazo.com/ba08dc85b449741dde748352d3b871e9.gif[/img] [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/s087rE3.png[/img] [IMG]https://i.gyazo.com/dd7d2bb53f2253aa6d3d82dc80a2a688.gif[/img] 100% Report Abuse [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/v2QOWsI.png[/img] [IMG]https://i.gyazo.com/67b8e2257f5b2abbbd0800b1c560b0a2.gif[/img] [IMG]https://i.gyazo.com/8c2700e726f44f91fd5840f76b2de0c9.gif[/img] [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/ogiyVA6.png[/img] [IMG]https://i.gyazo.com/a21b884a0f114197a24a339dc14fee4a.gif[/img] [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/dSjjkK4.png[/img] [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/i8v9GD8.png[/img] [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/m4qzlfx.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/bRUThRd.png[/img] Full Clan Chat
[IMG]https://i.gyazo.com/5b5b7607f30cbc99936ba413571fa13a.gif[/img] [IMG]https://i.gyazo.com/e2100a6d474b222dd8aed759f408b660.gif[/img]
[/spoiler]
[size=18pt][b]Official BETA Release Date: 20/08/2015 - YOUR ACCOUNTS WILL NOT RESET! [/b][/size]

item.title: RuneTopia | Advanced RuneScape 2006 Remake
item.dc:creator: @kaxman kaxman
item.description:
@kaxman wrote:

first isn’t pay2win, no ones asked for donations, or given anything for them , just icon in game…
link on home page …
secound isn’t about which game is better, about 1,000 games of fast, pay2win///and no real remakes with active community…So yall got yours and want all the same,
like I said most my friends love the fast…and enjoy the hell out of it, not hater
just when one come out with more than 5 and under on it, this one has population from start, never been without 8 or more on from start…and forums are alive
So just go play what ya like, let those who want this check it out, don’t get the kill the remake crowd…
anyway peace out , remember all about the love of the game…
and Server hasn’t been down for a sec… from start, have to wonder about previous post…
If they shouting lies about that, and as they say , have not checked out whats the motive, especially with advertisement in post…???

item.title: RuneTopia | Advanced RuneScape 2006 Remake
item.dc:creator: @kaxman kaxman
item.description:
@kaxman wrote:

still don’t get all the want to max in 1 day guys, sit in town and look pretty, jump from server to server, showing so much hate for a remake, that’s doing well,
have tryed out so many servers I can’t count them all, most of them have same group begging for same things, get them, max out fast and leave, server dies…
then there’s a solid group of true oldschool players who like the grind, like a challange, not that one or the other is better, but there are 1,000 of yalls, and very few remakes worth a crap…so
community is thriving, forums are active, and steady mid population, so
give it a try, ya might remember why you started playing the game…and find some sharp players who will kick with ya, all are welcome…peace

Read full topic

item.title: RuneTopia | Advanced RuneScape 2006 Remake
item.dc:creator: @Ketzer Ketzer
item.description:
@Ketzer wrote:

Niglett:

Hmm, not sure I agree it was a legitimate ban…

RuneTopia banned an individual with a history of repeat bug abuse when they registered an account on his server under the name “bug abuse” who later admitted to intending bug abuse after they agreed to not perpetrate any bug abuse. Where is the discrepancy here? It was never stated that the individual in question ever had to actually carry out their plans to infringe upon the rules, and as it is his server, it is fully within RuneTopia’s jurisdiction to decide what justifies penalty.

Niglett:

Regarding Silabsoft’s malicious intentions

I was referring to Miss Silabsoft’s offer to “find any potential dupe, dupe a bunch of items quietly and allow them to keep the account with the duped items” and her statement of “For your server I will make an exception and be one of those other bug abusers that do it to destroy economies/gain massive unfair advantages.”

Niglett:

Fair enough, however let’s look at this from different point of view. You could say Silabsoft is doing them a favor even if it’s out of spite; if they’re smart they could of easily spun the situation in their favor by correcting vulnerabilities that would cost them much more down the road, as it is still in a “beta” phase. It’s all strategic on how these types of situations are handled, they (the server owners) could have been the “bigger man” here and show that these types of attacks can be handled gracefully. What did they do instead? They decided it would be better to further aggravate the supposed “threat” to falsely show they are in control.

There should be no reason for a person to have to deal with an individual who holds the title of “ex-staff” as if they are acting out of spite. We should expect better from an average member of the community, and much more from those who should be role models. If Miss Silabsoft had in reality merely wanted to help the server, she would have contacted RuneTopia individually and proposed her idea, and if he accepted, proceeded to discretely find any issues and collaborate with RuneTopia to rectify them. She could have even published what had been done afterward without issue, provided that any problems reported on had been fixed. Instead, she accepted a contract requiring her to not perpetrate bug abuse with, as she has admitted, full intentions to violate the terms of her agreement. You cannot deny that Miss Silabsoft has acted completely unprofessionally here, and while some good might have come of it, that good was not in her primary intentions.

Niglett:

Anyway, I just want you to understand I’m on neither party’s side

Niglett:

3. I as well as others will likely be rooting for Silabsoft in this case

What?

Read full topic

item.title: RuneTopia | Advanced RuneScape 2006 Remake
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:22, topic:552997”]With the release of runetopia as promised I have created a download for runeagent with the configuration already created

https://cryptospout.com/runeagent/runetopia.zip

If you are still using Java 7 or lower you will want to comment load(‘nashorn:mozilla_compat.js’); in the configuration file.

If you find exploits be sure to post them here so others can learn about common server vulnerabilities.[/quote]

thanks!

Read full topic

item.title: RuneTopia | Advanced RuneScape 2006 Remake
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

With the release of runetopia as promised I have created a download for runeagent with the configuration already created

https://cryptospout.com/runeagent/runetopia.zip

If you are still using Java 7 or lower you will want to comment load(‘nashorn:mozilla_compat.js’); in the configuration file.

If you find exploits be sure to post them here so others can learn about common server vulnerabilities.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneTopia | Advanced RuneScape 2006 Remake
item.dc:creator: @runetopia runetopia
item.description:
@runetopia wrote:

[quote=“Scape-JAVA, post:20, topic:552997”]i see you’ve recently developed a report abuse system that sends the text entered to a notepad. gj.

To be fair, both Miss Silabsoft as well as RuneTopia are acting rather childish. I would say Miss Silabsoft more so seeing as she is the one who instigated the entire thing by reacting to what I see as a legitimate ban, seeing as she just admitted to intending bug abuse, with threats of ruining the server and the enjoyment of potentially hundreds of people. Additionally, Miss Silabsoft’s attempt to put herself forward as being innocent immediately after making these threats only further makes her seem both shallow and immature.

I can’t say that either party is fully within the right, but RuneTopia definitely stands on better ground here, as he simply made childish remarks, whereas Miss Silabsoft has made childish remarks, threats of malicious action, and has falsely claimed that this malicious action is actually in the spirit of benevolence.

How was her ban even remotely justified? Because she simply selected a commonly used private server name?

but RuneTopia definitely stands on better ground here

The only ground runetopia stands on is a mound of shit, moron.[/quote]

“stands on is a mound of shit” - haters are going to hate

Read full topic

I would say Miss Silabsoft more so seeing as she is the one who instigated the entire thing by reacting to what I see as a legitimate ban, seeing as she just admitted to intending bug abuse, with threats of ruining the server and the enjoyment of potentially hundreds of people. I can’t say that either party is fully within the right, but RuneTopia definitely stands on better ground here, as he simply made childish remarks, whereas Miss Silabsoft has made childish remarks, threats of malicious action, and has falsely claimed that this malicious action is actually in the spirit of benevolence.[/quote]

but RuneTopia definitely stands on better ground here

@kaxman wrote:

Come at someone with possible issues and sound solutions, is helpful.

Don’t be a problem, be a solution,

Read full topic

item.title: RuneTopia | Advanced RuneScape 2006 Remake
item.dc:creator: @Niglett Niglett
item.description:
@Niglett wrote:

[quote=“Ketzer, post:14, topic:552997”][quote author=Niglett link=topic=671908.msg4493711#msg4493711 date=1440014629]
Couple of things from an observer here…

  1. Not sure it was “professional” to ban someone based on their name alone, making the assumption that bug abuse was going to occur without any actual evidence or suggestion should make any player wonder why they’d bother joining…

  2. Resorting to ad hominem attacks because of your incompetence as a server owner is a big red flag to anyone wanting to play (server owner cannot handle criticisms and clearly does not address issues appropriately) for anyone wanting to play.

  3. I as well as others will likely be rooting for Silabsoft in this case, she did nothing wrong to deserve that ban. I’d have to say its quite naive to assume your players are going to follow rules without trying to break things, especially in this community. Naturally, once the bugs are abused and shown without any fixes it will only prove that you were never really fit to run a private server.

Oh well…
[/quote]

To be fair, both Miss Silabsoft as well as RuneTopia are acting rather childish. I would say Miss Silabsoft more so seeing as she is the one who instigated the entire thing by reacting to what I see as a legitimate ban, seeing as she just admitted to intending bug abuse, with threats of ruining the server and the enjoyment of potentially hundreds of people. Additionally, Miss Silabsoft’s attempt to put herself forward as being innocent immediately after making these threats only further makes her seem both shallow and immature.

I can’t say that either party is fully within the right, but RuneTopia definitely stands on better ground here, as he simply made childish remarks, whereas Miss Silabsoft has made childish remarks, threats of malicious action, and has falsely claimed that this malicious action is actually in the spirit of benevolence.[/quote]

Hmm, not sure I agree it was a legitimate ban… there is nothing otherwise suggesting that she did anything other than signing up. Let’s look at whats been presented:

Regarding Silabsoft’s malicious intentions

considering the server isn't even open it was just the name of my character. Maybe I wanted to play legitimately with that name

This gives us no indication on her original intent and whether or not it was malicious in nature, so anything suggesting it was more than that is merely speculation at best.

On the other hand RuneTopia seems to only post that Silabsoft had somehow already violated the rules without any actual evidence at to what bugs were exploited if any…:

You are just showing the community how unprofesional you are, you accepted to the rules before joining, bug abusing isn't allowed. If you don't like the rules, please leave as stated

Unless otherwise proven, I cannot see how the ban was justified. I want to also point out, it is the server operator’s responsibility to cover and prevent any types of attacks regardless of their intention, it is after all a cheating community so I don’t feel sorry for them as other servers have had to endure the same.

I can't say that either party is fully within the right, but RuneTopia definitely stands on better ground here, as he simply made childish remarks, whereas Miss Silabsoft has made childish remarks, threats of malicious action, and has falsely claimed that this malicious action is actually in the spirit of benevolence.

Fair enough, however let’s look at this from different point of view. You could say Silabsoft is doing them a favor even if it’s out of spite; if they’re smart they could of easily spun the situation in their favor by correcting vulnerabilities that would cost them much more down the road, as it is still in a “beta” phase. It’s all strategic on how these types of situations are handled, they (the server owners) could have been the “bigger man” here and show that these types of attacks can be handled gracefully. What did they do instead? They decided it would be better to further aggravate the supposed “threat” to falsely show they are in control.

Anyway, I just want you to understand I’m on neither party’s side, I don’t agree with how either party approached this situation frankly, but in all reality Silabsoft will do what she wants, whether its right or not is not really our justification to make.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneTopia | Advanced RuneScape 2006 Remake
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

runetopia:

:palm:

Judging by your response and the time between my post and yours, you went to the tl;dr and took nothing from it.

Good luck, then.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneTopia | Advanced RuneScape 2006 Remake
item.dc:creator: @runetopia runetopia
item.description:
@runetopia wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:15, topic:552997”]You had no reason to preban Silab’s username except that you could not fix, or even make an attempt to fix, the exploits you clearly know exist. If you had at least attempted to fix these exploits, you’d likely be thanking her (it’s a BETA afterall?).

She can, and will, ruin your server’s economy through these exploits, even though she knows it’s wrong and against her own program’s purpose. If you had at least made an attempt to fix the exploits ahead of time and were lucky enough to avoid the menstrual cycle at the same time, she might not have decided to act like she did.

I don’t support the use of RuneAgent to ruin a server and its playerbase. I don’t understand how it is constructive to destroy a server because it contains exploits. Yes we should be building more secure and stable private servers, but there is no reason a private server project that is not running for the strict goal of money deserves to be destroyed for not having competent developers for that small of a playerbase. The developers SHOULD try and fix these exploits with effort, but if they cannot and receive no help in doing so then they should not be PUNISHED. In this case, you were aware of the exploits and took steps to prevent specific members from getting to them. You did not make an attempt. So, you are punished.

tl;dr she will get to you one way or another, attempt to fix your exploits and maybe she will help you in the long run[/quote]

:palm:

Read full topic

item.title: RuneTopia | Advanced RuneScape 2006 Remake
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

You had no reason to preban Silab’s username except that you could not fix, or even make an attempt to fix, the exploits you clearly know exist. If you had at least attempted to fix these exploits, you’d likely be thanking her (it’s a BETA afterall?).

She can, and will, ruin your server’s economy through these exploits, even though she knows it’s wrong and against her own program’s purpose. If you had at least made an attempt to fix the exploits ahead of time and were lucky enough to avoid the menstrual cycle at the same time, she might not have decided to act like she did.

I don’t support the use of RuneAgent to ruin a server and its playerbase. I don’t understand how it is constructive to destroy a server because it contains exploits. Yes we should be building more secure and stable private servers, but there is no reason a private server project that is not running for the strict goal of money deserves to be destroyed for not having competent developers for that small of a playerbase. The developers SHOULD try and fix these exploits with effort, but if they cannot and receive no help in doing so then they should not be PUNISHED. In this case, you were aware of the exploits and took steps to prevent specific members from getting to them. You did not make an attempt. So, you are punished.

tl;dr she will get to you one way or another, attempt to fix your exploits and maybe she will help you in the long run

item.title: RuneTopia | Advanced RuneScape 2006 Remake
item.dc:creator: @Ketzer Ketzer
item.description:
@Ketzer wrote:

[quote=“Niglett, post:13, topic:552997”]Couple of things from an observer here…

  1. Not sure it was “professional” to ban someone based on their name alone, making the assumption that bug abuse was going to occur without any actual evidence or suggestion should make any player wonder why they’d bother joining…

  2. Resorting to ad hominem attacks because of your incompetence as a server owner is a big red flag to anyone wanting to play (server owner cannot handle criticisms and clearly does not address issues appropriately) for anyone wanting to play.

  3. I as well as others will likely be rooting for Silabsoft in this case, she did nothing wrong to deserve that ban. I’d have to say its quite naive to assume your players are going to follow rules without trying to break things, especially in this community. Naturally, once the bugs are abused and shown without any fixes it will only prove that you were never really fit to run a private server.

Oh well…[/quote]

To be fair, both Miss Silabsoft as well as RuneTopia are acting rather childish. I would say Miss Silabsoft more so seeing as she is the one who instigated the entire thing by reacting to what I see as a legitimate ban, seeing as she just admitted to intending bug abuse, with threats of ruining the server and the enjoyment of potentially hundreds of people. Additionally, Miss Silabsoft’s attempt to put herself forward as being innocent immediately after making these threats only further makes her seem both shallow and immature.

I can’t say that either party is fully within the right, but RuneTopia definitely stands on better ground here, as he simply made childish remarks, whereas Miss Silabsoft has made childish remarks, threats of malicious action, and has falsely claimed that this malicious action is actually in the spirit of benevolence.

Read full topic
